Question
========
You investigate whether attending an premier league soccer game has an effect on your own level of sports practice. You also examine whether this effect differs between real soccer fans and not real soccer fans. You draw a random sample of real soccer fans and another random sample of non-real soccer fans. Then you measure for each individual their physical activity before attending the soccer game, the day after attending the soccer game and 3 months after attending the soccer game. Other characteristics (e.g. education level, age) of the individual are also available.  
  
Which statistical model is correct for this situation?

Answerlist
----------
* One-way ANOVA
* Regression with a moderation effect (interaction)
* One-way repeated measures ANOVA
* Mixed-design ANOVA

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* False
* False
* False
* True
